Reviews.Title: Does not work
Reviews.Author: b0q
Reviews.Content: I very rarely if ever write product reviews, but my experience with this manufacturer has been so poor I had to write something.I have about 7 IP cameras at my home and place of business.  Many of them are foscam derivatives and I am reasonably happy with all of them.This is my second experience with Agasio cameras however, and both times the product was just junk.  My first try was with these HD cameras:http://www.amazon.com/Agasio-Megapixel-Wireless-Linkages-Definition/dp/B005DOTAMW/ref=sr_1_3?ie=UTF8&qid;=1336227432&sr;=8-3I bought 2 of these cameras, they never worked properly.Despite the bad experience with the other Agasio cameras, and the bad reviews on the A602 I decided to take a risk.The Agasio A602W is also just trash.  I set the camera up easily, but after that nothing went right.  The camera does not boot consistently.  If you unplug it and plug it back in it only starts maybe 1 in 10 times.  When it does start, the video cuts in and out.  There is an audible clicking sound that the camera makes over and over again, sometimes for hours.  I assume this is the cut filter or something with the IR trying to figure out if it needs to engage.Normally I would assume that I just received a bad camera.  But since this is my third product from this manufacturer I'm starting to think this brand is garbage.Try at your own risk, but my advice is to stay away.

Reviews.Title: Good if you use the cable but terrible wireless range
Reviews.Author: D. Hofmann
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use outdoors as a wireless webcam.  It has a great picture and works well when connected via the Cat5 jack.  But the antenna range for wireless is horrible.  I had to move the wireless access point from my office to the garage and the camera is 20 feet from the access point.  The only thing between the camera and access point is a wall and the performance is marginal and many times does not connect.  Do not buy this camera if you need a wireless camera for outdoors use.

Reviews.Title: Great color, clear pic!
Reviews.Author: Charles R. Yaunk
Reviews.Content: Camera is good quality for the price and works as advertised. Clear pics and great color. Wish it did have a wide angle lens though as mounted on top of my garage the area of view is very limited but to aim at a door or gate would be fine. Get it up as high as you practically can though. I use it as a wired camera even though it "can be" used as a wireless camera. I would only recommend someone use a wireless camera if it is the ONLY camera they have on their system. The ethernet cable is fairly inexpensive and will result in a much more reliable picture. Using wireless the signal can be lost often and frequently if using more than a single camera and I even installed higher gain antennas on router and cameras.

Reviews.Title: Good Cam, but limited viewing angle
Reviews.Author: 55ting55
Reviews.Content: I use this as a WeatherCam, check it out at[...]setup is easy, I set it to upload every 10 mins.Viewing angle is limited, my iPhone4 have about 30% winder viewing angle.iR LED CAN NOT BE TURNED OFF, it always be illuminated in the dark. This created a problem pointing camera out the window at night.

Reviews.Title: A bit underwhelmed
Reviews.Author: Owen DeLong "IPv6 Evangelist, Pilot, SCUBA In...
Reviews.Content: The camera claims to be designed for outdoor use and the chassis seems like it would hold up in a protected area, but the antenna attachment is definitely not weather proof. The cable coming out of the back of the camera does not appear to be weatherized. It's probably suitable for my purpose (I intend to mount it under a roof to surveil my front porch), but it is definitely not suited to true outdoor deployment.Many of the camera's functions are not available via the generic web interface, so if you aren't running Windows (and I am not), caveat emptor.The connections into the camera are very poor choices. The 5V power supply is via a simple (tiny) coaxial plug (not weatherized). There is no POE support on the hardwire ethernet connector. A reset button is also integrated into the cable. The cable is not removable and you cannot substitute hardwired power to the camera for a more secure installation. The cable provided is only about 3 feet long so your options to secure it are limited. My plan is to place a small outdoor electrical box on the wall next to the camera mount and place all the connections and a small 5V power supply inside that (hard wired).Otherwise the camera seems to mostly do as it claims and work reasonably well.

Reviews.Title: NO GOOD
Reviews.Author: RS
Reviews.Content: Junk. Camera FAILED after 4 months. Less than 60 degrees view, hard to setup and view, software doesn't allow more than 1/3 screen viewing on monitor, no more than 15 ft infra red night viewing, short (40ft) transmitting range even with booster on high powered router. Steer clear of these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Broke in 3 days time.
Reviews.Author: Niles Africh
Reviews.Content: Bought this product to try out the camera and quality. The daytime quality is pretty good, but the night vision is almost none even in a parking lot area with lights (In quality comparison to VideoSecu cameras used in past). The camera was set up under the ledge of a roof where it hardly would get rain or elements and power and Ethernet were in NEMA enclosure even though it was an outdoor camera. Everything went great and bam on the 3rd night the camera died. Tried to reset several times, the Ethernet port would not come on when plugged into routers or switches. I guess i had a bad model, but i have read many other similar stories prior to purchasing.

Reviews.Title: not for Apple
Reviews.Author: ANA J. ROMAN
Reviews.Content: You can view fine on Apple computer but you can't record. You will have to download separate software. Video has a slight delay

Reviews.Title: Camera did not work, but was replaced
Reviews.Author: R. Winans "woodturner"
Reviews.Content: After receiving this camera(01/02/2013), I plugged it in and the power supply did not work. I tried to get tech help from Foscam, but they did not answer the phone. I finally got in touch with sales@foscam.us (they are in India) and they said to use my amazon order number as the RMA number and mail it to Houston and they would fix it! No one has even acknowledged that it was received and it has not been returned yet! Update:02/07/13. I received my camera back, but it appears to a complete brand new one and it works right out of the box! If this camera keeps on working like this for a few weeks outside, then I will upgrade my star rating.UPDATE: Just finished with tech support and Ralph Mendez was fantastic. He logged on to my computer and had me operational wireless in very short order. I take all my bad stuff back and give them a 5 star rating!

Reviews.Title: Hard to setup and software is not real friendly
Reviews.Author: Professor "Wood worker"
Reviews.Content: It is a challenge to setup.  The software is hard to use and is not nearly as friendly as the Panasonic software.  The camera shows a washed out spot where it is always sunny.  I did not get the wireless part to work consistently and just settled for plugging it in.

Reviews.Title: Not as advertised
Reviews.Author: David_99
Reviews.Content: This camera did work, but I bought it specifically because the description said it had a 72 degree viewing angle - it certainly does not!  My best estimate is about 25 degrees, at most.  I wanted to have a view of my yard from the corner of the roof, all it gave me was a large shrub across the yard.  If you are using it outside at night, by the time the field of view is wide enough to be useful, you're already 50 or 60 feet away from the camera, and the infrared is fading out (and I can't back the house up, anyway).  If the viewing angle is not a problem for you, it should be fine.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the trouble
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: Camera is lackluster quality at best. The mount on this thing is a joke, looks junky and barely holds the camera steady. On mine, there is a haze around the view from the IR lights when night vision is working. And now after having it up for a few months with no major issues, other than what I previously mentioned, it will simply disconnect from my network, and not reconnect until I manually power it down and back up. I purchased a lower quality Tenvis camera, and although I've had some issues with it adjusting to sunrise / sunset, it's 10x better than the Agasio. Nice mount, very sturdy and looks more clean and slick. The only advantage to the Agasio I saw is that it has a 10db attenna, but that's it. Either go with a different brand or spend more money on a higher quality unit. This one will leave you frustrated. Hopefully will be able to return.

Reviews.Title: Decent but be careful about what you are getting.
Reviews.Author: AM "am amazon"
Reviews.Content: I decided to buy each of the Agasio 502W and Agasio 612W instead of the Foscams since they are the same company - this was a mistake. Stick to the Foscam brand since the Agasio website is nothing but junk and the forums are full of spam. Foscam site is a bit better. Also when planning to use these camera's with surveillance software, Foscam drivers are the most common.I am using the Agasio 502W with the Synology Disk Station NAS that also has a surveillance software builtin. The Agasio 502W corresponds to the Foscam 8918W and the Agasio 612W with Foscam 8905W for the purposes of the configuration. Also this is an MJPEG camera and not a H264 - so audio is only possible through dedicated apps not through surveillance software like the Synology. Foscam's H264 camera's have audio but from what I hear is difficult to setup and disconnects often.The Agasio 502W and Agasio 612W both were easy to setup and the web interface, while clunky, worked well enough. You MUST be tech savvy to know Dynamic IP vs Static IP etc. The presets in Agasio 502W are useful - however, they get messed up very easily by a cam viewer and once disturbed, it confuses the surveillance station. I have it setup so that when motion is triggered, it goes trough a preset patrol sequence and records the movie. This has worked well except when the presets are disturbed manually.Also note that the Agasio 502W has a much wider field of view than Agasio 612W. Also while the Agasio 612W is waterproof, both are NOT meant for freezing temperatures.I have both Agasio 502W and Agasio 612W setup wirelessly through an Apple Time Machine Airport router to the Synology DS and they have worked well without disconnect. Recordings have also been good and motion detection has worked well.I am going to keep both Agasio 502W and Agasio 612W camera's and see how they perform.NOTE- WARNING - If you are accessing the camera's through a Dynamic DNS service, be VERY CAREFUL - there are several hacks and cracks available online that will allow strangers to break in, view and monitor your camera's. See this:http://www.informationweek.com/security/vulnerabilities/wireless-camera-flaws-allow-remote-explo/240153001#mc_jiveSo using the camera's via a surveillance software is recommended. Foscam does not seem to care about this - I dont see any response to this on their site.

Reviews.Title: Not Wireless (Large wire hanging off camera)
Reviews.Author: Robert D. Schmidt
Reviews.Content: This may be a great camera, but I will never know, because there is a large two-foot black wire hanging off the back of the camera. I thought that I could discretely run power to this camera and put it on my front porch, but there is no way that this wire will be discrete (see customer image).Every photo of this camera does not show this wire. Open the box, and "Hey, surprise! Look what's hanging there." The whole purpose of going wireless is so there is no network wire running up to the camera. I am not going to give it one star for being misleading, so I will simply give it three stars.Update:Okay, after I got over the shock of the camera having a tail, I was okay with it. I mounted it by my front door, so we could see you is ringing our bell. I t works well at this, and it works during the day and at night, which is really cool. I would be happier, if the lens had a wider angle, because it is difficult to set up so that we can see a person's face at different distances.I also set the email function. Now, every time someone enters or exists our house, i get sent up to six photos. Really cool to watch. Also, I can see when the UPS guy comes.Changed my rating to a four: Wish I could remove the tail, and the camera had a wider angle. BTW, don't need software, just log into the camera!

Reviews.Title: Great performance for inexpensive camera
Reviews.Author: Nick
Reviews.Content: I chose this camera as I needed something to cover my drive after a spate of auto burglaries in the neighborhood.  I am very familiar with setting up wired and wireless network hardware so this was no problem, indeed it has one of the easier interfaces I've encountered.  The unit seems sturdy and has a nice metal enclosure.When installing, the supplied bracket is completely functional although low-cost.  The short pigtail of wires will cause problems for some home installers - I made a long low-voltage power lead and then used a higher voltage supply at the end of it to provide the camera with 5v after the drop in the wire.  I am using wireless-G for the network connection, which is not my preference (wired would be for smoother image and robustness) but the location is too difficult for wired.The image quality is good both day and night.  The advertised 67-degree viewing angle is true, corner to corner, so imagine about +-30 degrees of the camera's boresight and that's your field of view.  It seems small when you get it setup, so you'll need to mount far/high up.  Mine is under the eaves of the house and covers the drive nicely.I would definitely buy another of these if needed as they are great value.

Reviews.Title: Best camera for the money
Reviews.Author: William A. Yeager
Reviews.Content: I replaced all of my old security cameras I had here because of their limited ability. I played around with Foscam which is a piece of junk. Foscam does not have the range I needed here nor did it work correctly. I decided to try Agasio and found that the A602W was the best for distance monitoring. The only draw back is the auto iris which does not seem to work correctly when the sun is overhead. Other than that, these babys are the best for the money.

Reviews.Title: Agasio A602W absolutely no good.
Reviews.Author: KenH
Reviews.Content: Hooked up camera and colors were terrible.(So much for TRUE COLOR!!) Obviously the IR cut filter did not work. Night vision might be 30 feet.(NOT 65 ft.) After running for 1 day colors really went to pot, everything had  a rainbow of colors outlining it. I installed camera about 25 feet from router and had frequent drop outs. After the 1 day trial I returned for a refund. I DO NOT recommend this camera for any usage.I have 3 other wireless cameras(LOFTEK) and they are much better than this one. I should have paid attention to other reviews of this camera and not wasted my time.

Reviews.Title: One is ok.....
Reviews.Author: Kristi D. Dougan
Reviews.Content: This was a bit difficult to get setup on the computer but worked well once I got setup. I purchased a second one and now neither works well. The second one constantly disconnects which messes up the other one.

Reviews.Title: Agasio cameras
Reviews.Author: Wayne J. Courson
Reviews.Content: The "night vision" did not work so I called support and they replaced the camera with a Foscam camera because they no longer supported the Agasio cameras.Foscam support was excellent - the best I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: Works fine
Reviews.Author: Charles D. Martin "dzldan"
Reviews.Content: I have 4 of these cameras and all work well even in WiFi mode. My older cameras do not work well on WiFi, which is why I am replacing them a few at a time.

Reviews.Title: need better packaging.
Reviews.Author: cjw49
Reviews.Content: Can not say if this is a good product or not. I was never able to get it to work. It was not packed very well and when I took it out of the box the top shield was askew so I think USPS might have drop kicked it to the post office.

Reviews.Title: So far so good...
Reviews.Author: a guy.
Reviews.Content: I received this camera last week, and fully mounted it to the outside of the house today. Upon receiving the camera, I had it on my home wireless network in 10 minutes or less. The image is as good as I was expecting, and I look forward to seeing video of the neighborhood hoodlums when they enter my property. I see a lot of people complaining about the camera's recording/motion detection, for me it is no big deal as I already had planned on using another piece of software to monitor/record from the camera. (http://www.ispyconnect.com/)*edit*Down to 4 stars, as the infrared is pretty bad.

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Andrew "Andrew"
Reviews.Content: This camera connects and is stable about 100 to 120 feet at my house, through 2 walls and trees. my router show 29% signal.it is not a great picture but does the job, the IR is good indoors (its in my barn) but out doors, not so much even on full moon days

Reviews.Title: A602W
Reviews.Author: lubbe
Reviews.Content: The camera works reliable; I had problems installing the software; the support team helped me getting the problem resolved and start the camera.Thank you

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it
Reviews.Author: Eric R. Burns "Eric"
Reviews.Content: Rarely write reviews, but felt compelled for this camera.I thought it would be quicker and easier than running wires for a complete dvr system.  I was wrong.  I spent several hours trying to connect the cameras via wifi.  After that process i had to call customer no service and talk with a rep for an hour and a half (plus 30 mins on hold) for him to discover that one of my two cameras was faulty.  No problem, he was going to have another rep call me back to fix the problem.  The following rep determined one of my two cameras was defective.I tried one of my two cameras for 24 hours (the one that worked).  While the camera was overlooking my driveway, a friend pulled in.  We spoke and he left, not one peice of the 5 minute event was captured.  Apparently the motion detection feature has up to a 60 second delay, but still should have recorded something.Maybe the $500 ip cams work, but this is a pos.

Reviews.Title: Sturdy, fairly easy to install
Reviews.Author: PM12
Reviews.Content: From a "techy's" point of view the setup was fairly straight forward,  if you aren't familiar with WiFI and basic networking you may find it a bit challenging.  The documentation was apparently written by someone who speaks english as a second language.  Having said that,  the camera itself is very sturdy, the mounting bracket is sufficient however don't over tighten the plastic knob that keeps the camera steady on the mount. (I accidentally broke that, easily fixed with a nut and flat washer.)  The operation of the camera, however, was very straight forward and the picture quality is excellent.  I also like the built-in DDNS feature so I can easily view the camera from the internet.  It also works great with third party security software products (like the free iSpy).I would have given it a 5 stars but the mounting stand and the poor english of the manual cost it a star, however I would purchase another one. (in fact I may.)

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: scott did a great job helping me set up the cameras to see everything in one screen. Also helped set up recording to one of our hard drives. I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Good tech support
Reviews.Author: Labor of Love
Reviews.Content: Is a decent camera though the software/manual are a bit hard to use/follow. I talked with Kate at tech support today and she was very helpful. Wait time was less than 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Lisa B.
Reviews.Content: We got 2 of these.  They give us the peace of mind that our property is secure when were away and we can check on the house and barn when we are gone or at home relaxing.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: A. Qazi
Reviews.Content: I needed help setting up the camera after purchase. I called tech support and the rep took care of everything. He got my camera configured and even set up the remote view so I could watch from my phone! The picture quality was great while I was in the same room as the router. When I went downstairs I got constant disconnects. The wifi adapter just isn't strong enough. I ordered a repeater hopefully that will help. I use other wifi device downstairs without any problems, so that is why I had to lower the rating. Originally I did give this product 5 stars, while on the phone with the agent he requested that I submit my feedback before I hung up. I should have informed him I needed to fully test before submitting a review.

Reviews.Title: Looks in every way to be a foscam but its not
Reviews.Author: Woof
Reviews.Content: IR does not work at all and it says it is 65 ft rangeDoes not have the 71 deg view...it is 32 degColor was total washout for 2 days of run time then it magically turned on regular colorCRAP

Reviews.Title: Technical Support
Reviews.Author: M. A. Velazquez
Reviews.Content: Needed help with setting up the camera wirelessly and remotely. I was very happy with the tech help highly recommendThe camera has very good features and the picture quality is very good. I would purchase more cameras in future.

Reviews.Title: Great outdoor camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Michelle Ge
Reviews.Content: I mounted this unit to monitor the garage driveway. I configured this as wireless and performed as advertised. The only thing is that this unit location is a bit too far from my wireless router so an extender was added. So far, work perfectly. Also make sure you use fixed IP address, in order to be able to monitor this remotely.

Reviews.Title: Agasio - Great Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Ragan
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera and was having a hard time setting it up. I called the tech support number and spoke to Calvin Harris. He was so helpful in getting this up and working so that I could view my camera from my home computer as well as my iPhone. The camera has great video quality and i like the interface. I would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Agasio
Reviews.Author: Barbara Overstreet
Reviews.Content: Very Happy with camera and support thanks to calvin. reat picture, fun and easy to use. i would reccomend it to someone else.

Reviews.Title: great job worked out both camera and ip issues
Reviews.Author: Mike Dyess
Reviews.Content: Calvin did a great job connecting both the camera and the ip issues.  Did a great job. The cameras best feature is the ability to watch from your android tablets and phones anywhere at any time.

Reviews.Title: Works Well
Reviews.Author: Linus69
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite outdoor IP Cameras, it works well and has a strong signal. I would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture and fun to use
Reviews.Author: Jim Bob Oakley
Reviews.Content: Never in my life have I had to work with something that had such poor documentation.  It's obviously Chinese processed through a translator.  Words are missing, grammar is wrong and they often use the wrong words.  There were three or four pieces of software, only two of which I use.  The guide will have to be read multiple times to understand.  Oh, and the CAT 5 cable they included was defective.  I was stumped until I swapped it out and finally, the network saw the camera.  That was the hardest part, getting network recognition.Then it sat around the house a few days, shooting boring pics of my living room, until I finally figured out how to rig up the wireless capability.  When I finally got this mounted outside, wow, it was a blast to use.  I point it to my truck in the parking lot of the condo and enjoy watching who is driving by.  It saves me many trips in and out to check on the latest commotion outside.  Unlike others, I LIKE the red dots from the IR eyes.  I want people to know I am watching them, so that they stay away from my vehicle and my area.The neighbor that required me to buy this thing in the first place has moved on, but now other neighbors are busy being loud, having too many cars and visitors and generally just raising too much heck for my taste.  I plan on getting a second one soon.  If you can stomach all the tech challenges required to get this thing working, you will be very pleased with the quality.  I don't record much on mine.  I just like to watch the action outside as it happens.  The web browser control is pretty good; it's all I need.

Reviews.Title: Agasio A602W Outdoor Wireless IP Camera with IR-Cut Off Filter
Reviews.Author: les
Reviews.Content: Have 2 of the Agasio A602W Outdoor Wireless IP Camera with IR-Cut Off Filter. had trouble with 1 of the cameras night vision, work and the shut off. try many reboots nothing,was getting ready to ship back for refund, but the camera started to work.(maybe one of those things). I giving a 5 star because the picture quality is good,the teck support good, delivery is fast.  thank you

Reviews.Title: OK camera for looking, no so good for recording
Reviews.Author: Dstymn
Reviews.Content: This camera actually has a fairly decent viewing image when watching from a web browser. I tried connecting this both as a wired and wireless cameras, image quality didn't appear to be effected. The instructions included aren't that great, but messing around with the settings once you get into them will help you figure out what you can do. Make sure you have a windows computer with internet explorer for changing any settings, as with any other browser you will only be allowed to View.Don't count on the alarm function and automatic record function being very useful. From my experience, someone 50+ feet way could walk straight across the camera's field of view before it would both alarm and record images. When checking back, all the recordings where the same, nothing in sight, and no indication of what set it off.If you want a cheapish IP camera to check on things occasionally, this would work great for you.

Reviews.Title: These are good cameras, only shortcoming is the installation instructions
Reviews.Author: Thomas Simmons "Big Ugly Guy"
Reviews.Content: Second Agasio IP Cam. If you've done network assignment before these are easy to set up. If you're experience in networking is light, you may get confused on some of the steps needed to change the default password. Also, when installing more than one, make sure you have all units powered so they will get assigned different addresses.The camera, once set up, is reliable and interfaces well with Ispy (pen source software) The IR lights,can be cycled on and off,but better to use the Agasio Net Software for that.I like these cameras for external use as the wire harness can be tucked inside some form of housing (with a battery, for example). I have yet to have really nasty weather, so can't confirm it's resistancmoistureisure and cold temps.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: blacktip
Reviews.Content: So far this camera was relatively easy to set up.  The main issue that I had upon setup was getting ddns to work (where you can view your live camera from outside your home network).  I still haven't gotten that resolved, even after forwarding the correct ports it's still not working.  Either way, I got the smtp to work so the camera will forward incremented photos to my email when it detect movement.  Night vision is decent, I could see some external ir lights helping illuminate the desired area better at night.Either way, good price, decently easy to set up.  The interface looks like they could have spent a bit more time on, it looks a bit like they got a second year programming student to program the interface....but its basic functionality works.

Reviews.Title: Camera Review
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Berman "Ken"
Reviews.Content: Camera works great.  I do not have any of the "halo" effect some reviewers mentioned. The IR night vision is outstanding.  I can clearly make out any person walking on my deck 40' away day or night 65' during the day.If you are using a Mac you will need to change some IP info to get it working.  If you are not familiar with the process calling Foscam will get you up and running in 30 minutes.  I am using it with Vitamin D software for monitoring.  That seems to be the best platform available for Apple. Blue Iris IS NOT MAC COMPATIBLE.  DO NOT ORDER AN EXTRA MOUNTING BRACKET!!!  All the cameras including the Foscams come with brackets included in the packaging.  For some reason no one tells you that!Happy viewing

Reviews.Title: Best outdoor wifi camera
Reviews.Author: Just a guy
Reviews.Content: I have tried (and returned) several outdoor wifi cameras.  I just wanted something I could point down my driveway.  This is essentially a Foscam but somehow seems better made.  The only downside is that it has fewer night vision LEDS.  So, the night vision isn't spectacular, but I can still see 75 feet or so.  PLUS the colors in daytime are accurate.  Green is green.  Not white.  Wifi connection was a breeze, although wifi range is pretty poor.Before mounting make sure you have a strong wifi signal where you want to mount this.  Just hold up your cell phone and check the wifi strength.  I assume you want this to work over wifi.  Otherwise save a lot of money and just get a ethernet camera.Optics are good and it is a nice wide angle.

Reviews.Title: Agasio A602W
Reviews.Author: wirehead70
Reviews.Content: Great Cam the web interface is still not what it should be.Everytime motion is triggered and you have the WI open it opens a file on my pc and its no way to stop it.All I use the WI for now is to change settings.I have called tech support about it and they came into my pc and said he would email me a WI with a fix for it and never did Its been a month ago.The A603 is a better cam for only $10 more it is also a big cam with awesome night vision and also has the same WI as the 602 with the same problems.I use Blue iris with them and have not had any problems.11-17-2012

Reviews.Title: Better then Expected !
Reviews.Author: RazzleDazzle
Reviews.Content: When I first saw this product, I thought it was to good to be true. But I was truly shocked. They have amazing picture quality for the money, also I was able to connect them to my WiFi in just a few minutes time. The only down side is the included software is horrible, if is always freezing rendering the record function useless. I have been actively seeking better software and will update this review when I do.But all in all for the money I don't think you could really go wrong with these ipcams. Just keep in mind you will have to purchase separate software for the recording and viewing functions.

Reviews.Title: Great quality for the price, easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Artin F. "Art"
Reviews.Content: I just installed my first Agasio camera, great picture quality for the price of under $100.The GUI is pretty good, much better than other Foscam cameras i have bought before.

Reviews.Title: Good surveillance Camera. Excellent quality images and color
Reviews.Author: Robin
Reviews.Content: The Agasio A602 Outdoor wireless IP camera performs well. The software setup was a bit difficult at first. Then I called the Agasio tech support person via their toll free number. He and I did a "remote session" whereby he set up my camera to my satisfaction. It's always "service after the sale" that means a lot to any customer. His expertise left me a very satisfied customer. The camera now works well. I am glad to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Agasio Camera
Reviews.Author: Richard Folkvard
Reviews.Content: Issue: Set the camera.Feedback about the camera: I thoroughly enjoy the products I have purchased from Agasio which are the Agasio A602W Outdoor Wireless IP Cameras. They have terrific coverage coverage and the fact that I can view images taken and recorded on my cell phone are fantasic.Feedback about the service: Ricky our service agent was as terrific. He set up and handled all matters in a timely manner and I couldn't be happier with his service. I would highly recommend the products as well the agent, Ricky who helped me. Thanks Agasio!

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: CaptGump
Reviews.Content: Camera works great.  I have it set up outside to view my driveway.  I needed a little IT help setting it up and make it able to view with IP Cam viewer app.  I have it connected via the Cat5 cable and am using a POE injector and splitter to provide power.  This is the first of 3 outdoor cameras I am setting up.

Reviews.Title: installation support
Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: very knowledgable tech support for installation. The remote feature with tech controlling screen was very helpful. Tech was courteous and patient through the process (Calvin Harris was the tech.)

Reviews.Title: Wireless camera
Reviews.Author: Virginia D.
Reviews.Content: The instruction book appeared translated andthe font so tiny it was almost impossible to read.The dvd was vague and I learned that it's wirelessrange is minimal.  Decided to pass and spend moremoney for a whole house wired system.

Reviews.Title: Good camera - NO SUPPORT
Reviews.Author: bluesky
Reviews.Content: The camera seems to be working properly since purchase a few weeks ago.  The Agasio support is non-existent online as the forums have been taken over by someone promoting porn and kitchens ?  There doesn't appear to be any recent updates and most of the sub-sites are empty.  Looks like a ghost town.Found most of my answers on the Foscam site, but unfortunately I cannot match up firmware versions across the two brands.  And, if you ask any kind of technical question it will be ignored.So, bottom line ... you are buying a generic camera with very limited support.  Shop around if you are not technically proficient and unwilling to cruise other sites for support !I would personally suggest buying elsewhere and plan to do so myself when shopping for the next one.

Reviews.Title: Tech Support
Reviews.Author: Chris Groves
Reviews.Content: Had issues with the wireless installation of a camera, Felix was a exceptional in assisting my issue. I do like the camera will use it for some time and further update it.

Reviews.Title: Easy set up
Reviews.Author: RWL
Reviews.Content: Product was easy to set up and picture quality is good. Wireless range decent for a camera in this price range.

Reviews.Title: Recieved cameras were not wireless.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I ordered 2 of these refurbished through Amazon but neither camera that arrived was a wireless camera.  I thought maybe they just went to an internal antenna but nope.  The external camera case has printing of options and wireless was not checked on either, no antenna was present and software does not allow setup of any wireless setting.  The box had a sticky label that did say wireless but this proved incorrect.  I don't know who the blame lies with, Amazon or the seller but beware that, at least the refurbished ones, are NOT wireless.  I returned both.

Reviews.Title: customer service
Reviews.Author: Joseph W.
Reviews.Content: i had an issue with port forwarding with this camera .. so i called their tech support and spoke with harry Foster. He was able to remote access my computer and was able to make the camera work wireless to begin with and then he was able to make it work with port forwarding so that I'm able to view the camera remotely when I'm away from my home location.  The picture quality is very good and the software is very intuitive.  I am very satisfied with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: Support was awesome !
Reviews.Author: PJK1954 "marian3410"
Reviews.Content: Have 4 cameras. Wanted them to work on a new network. Couldn't do it. Called Foscam, they arranged a call back time and actually called on time ! :)  Ralph Mendez called and spent an hour with me and got everything working !!  I like these cameras have had 2 for about 2 years and just bought the Agasio's.  They work great, I would recommend Foscam and Agasio cameras !!

Reviews.Title: best best best
Reviews.Author: jay
Reviews.Content: best tech support  also best picture camera.  i can recommend this product to every oneJudy  she is best tech supporter

Reviews.Title: no customer service
Reviews.Author: Jerry L. Laur
Reviews.Content: Can not get to operate wireless with my mac. Called customer service. Because I'm hard of hearing and 72 I could not understand the indian women and she said there was no American male I could talk to! This sucks!

Reviews.Title: thanks everything
Reviews.Author: terry
Reviews.Content: All the support team did a great job thx and Calvin$$$...The colors and shipping turn out good thanks for everything... Any body in to wireless camera this is the one!!!

Reviews.Title: technical support
Reviews.Author: mary
Reviews.Content: needed help with installation of the cameras remotely. Ralph Mendez was extremely patient and helpful. At this point i am very happy with this product.  i would highly reccommend this product

Reviews.Title: Camera Support
Reviews.Author: Gerald
Reviews.Content: felix anderson this service was top of the line very professonal. this kind of service makes me want to by another camera and recomend it to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: customer support
Reviews.Author: P. Neiman
Reviews.Content: i have 2 nd camera was unable to set it up .. spoke with Harry Foster he was able to make the camera work wirelessly and alos was able to do the port forwarding so tht im able to view the camera remotely .. i have 2 of these cameras and the feature tht i like is tht whr ever iam i can get connected to my cam frm any other location ... also i like the viewing angle which the camera provides me .....

Reviews.Title: customer support
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: was unable to get the camera up and running . got a call back from the tech support spoke with harry foster was able to make my camera work wirelessly ..  The service was quick and helpful.  So simple!

Reviews.Title: Tech support was spot on. Got me up and running
Reviews.Author: Harry
Reviews.Content: could not connect the camera wirelessly and remotely. Ralph Mendez solved my problem to my complete satisfaction. The product seems to be top notch and i can recommend it..I will strongly consider this brand in the future

Reviews.Title: User friendly - NOT!
Reviews.Author: Timothy Mead
Reviews.Content: I didn't notice that the camera was made in China when I bought it, but I sure did once I started reading the instructions. DO NOT BUY!!! I can't even figure out how to make this thing work. Zero stars is a better mark.

Reviews.Title: CEO
Reviews.Author: Bernardo Torres
Reviews.Content: i need two out door cameras and 6 indoor for two deferment building wireless how mach cost me the total kit for internet any ware / 3 floor each building.Bernardo Torres bgerealty@gmail.com

Reviews.Title: customer support
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: I had an issue with one of my camera was not working wireless ... spoke with harry foster he was able to remote access to my computer and was able to make it work wireless. i have two of the cameras and they work just fine

Reviews.Title: Fosam Support
Reviews.Author: Vicky
Reviews.Content: Kate Miller did an excellent job and professional in meeting my needs with the installation and set up of my camera.  She is very patient with me as well as understanding my needs.  Kate is Very Proficent in her work and in workin with the public.  I could understand her pretty well.  So, far I love the camera's/  Well worth the investment in todays world no matter where you live.Vicky

Reviews.Title: Delivered something other than what I ordered!
Reviews.Author: W. Henderson
Reviews.Content: I ordered [the] Agasio A602w on 032412, it was delivered via FedEx on 032612.  Great $3.00 extra two day delivery service.  I don't know how Amazon does it.  HOWEVER - Amazon did not deliver what I had ordered.  I purchased the Agasio A602A specifically because it had the best advertised camera capture angle " . . .Agasio A602W Outdoor Wireless IP Camera with IR-Cut Off Filter for TRUE COLOR Images (Not Washed Out), Auto-Iris (Auto-Brightness Adjustment), IP66 Waterproof Enclosure, 65ft Nightvision, 4mm lens (72° Viewing Angle), Synology & Blue Iris Compatible,, SILVER."  What was delivered was a A602A with a camera capture angle of ONLY 60 degrees (as per the User Manual Specifications) NOT THE 72 DEGREES THAT IS ADVERTISED ON AMAZON'S WEB SITE!  This is a significant performance difference with this type of security camera. INTERESTED BUYERS BEWARE!  As most of you know successfully telephoning Amazon to complain or seek redress for this kind of bate & switch is next to impossible.  The $10.00 ~ $12.00 out of pocket return shipping expense will cause me to keep this camera and place it in a location suitable to its (reduced) capabilities.  THANKS AMAZON FOR THIS PIECE OF TRICKERY.  I WON'T BE ORDERING FROM AMAZON THE THREE ADDITIONAL CAMERAS I STILL REQUIRE TO CAMPLETE MY HBOME SECURITY SYSTEM, I CAN'T TRUST YOU TO DELIVBER WHAT I ORDER!

Reviews.Title: Foscam Customer Service
Reviews.Author: josmi
Reviews.Content: This camera, an Agasio A602W, works well. I was having a problem with reassigned ip addresses when the modem (Netgear CG3000D) rebooted but 'adarsh' (890 726 743) at Foscam Customer Service resolved the issue promptly by using ports in the 8090 range.

ProductInfo.Features:
24 IR-LEDs for upto 20 meters (65feet) Night Vision - Features an IR-Cut Filter for true and accurately colored images (e.g., greens appear green rather than grey or brown); Wi-Fi compliant with wireless standards IEEE 802.11b/g - 640x480 Resolution; 0.3 Megapixel (Synology & Blue Iris Compatible)
Features an Auto-Iris function which automatically adjusts the lens depending on lighting conditions so images do not appear washed out and do not require manual brightness adjustment; Supports M-JPEG video compression - Supports wireless encryption using WEP, WPA and WPA2 - Motion detection alerts via emailed images and FTP image upload
Features an IP66 hardened outdoor waterproof enclosure;  Provides for remote viewing & recording over the local network or the internet through a PC or mobile device (including Iphone, Android & Blackberry); Supports DHCP, fixed/static IP and PPPOE - Multi-level user management and password protection - Allows for remote viewing and recording from anywhere in the world through the internet - Supports DDNS for dynamic IP address stabilization
Supports smartphones (Iphone & Android) as well as standard browsers (Internet Explorer, Firefox, Safari, Chrome)
Simple to setup with an easy to use graphical interface;  Motion Detection with email image notifications and image upload via FTP
ProductInfo.Name: Agasio A602W Outdoor Wireless IP Camera with IR-Cut Off Filter for TRUE COLOR Images (Not Washed Out), Auto-Iris (Auto-Brightness Adjustment), IP66 Waterproof Enclosure, 65ft Nightvision, 4mm lens (72° Viewing Angle), Synology & Blue Iris Compatible,, SILVER
